wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Galloway Dunlop du Roy de Blicquy Galbraith, 2nd Baron Strathclyde,  (born 22 February 1960), known informally as Tom Strathclyde, is a British Conservative politician. Lord Strathclyde served in the political role of Leader of the House of Lords from the 2010 general election until January 2013 and as Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster, having been Leader of the Opposition in the House of Lords (1998–2010).

response: *1960 – Thomas Galbraith, 2nd Baron Strathclyde, Scottish politician, Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster

Alumni in UK politics include the Labour Members of Parliament Rachael Maskell (Physiotherapy, 1994), and Karin Smyth (Politics, 1988); two former Leaders of the House of Lords, Valerie Amos, Baroness Amos (Applied Research in Education, 1978),‘AMOS’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and Thomas Galbraith, 2nd Baron Strathclyde (Modern Languages & European Studies, 1982);‘STRATHCLYDE’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and the Liberal Democrat peer Rosalind Scott, Baroness Scott of Needham Market (European Studies, 1999).‘SCOTT OF NEEDHAM MARKET’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 UEA is also the alma mater of the former Crossbench peer Timothy Bentinck, 12th Earl of Portland (History of Art, 1975); and the former Members of Parliament Caroline Flint (American Literature, History & Film, 1983),‘FLINT, Rt Hon. Caroline Louise’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Douglas Carswell (History, 1993), Tony Colman (International Development), Jon Owen Jones (Ecology, 1975), Tess Kingham (Education), Judith Chaplin and Ivor Stanbrook (Law, 1995).
